trans-unit.source: Create a Logic App | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a Logic App | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a basic App Services Logic App
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a basic App Services Logic App

trans-unit.source: Create a new logic app
trans-unit.target: Create a new logic app

trans-unit.source: Quick Reference
trans-unit.target: Quick Reference

trans-unit.source: Logic Apps Definition Language
trans-unit.target: Logic Apps Definition Language

trans-unit.source: Logic Apps Connector Documentation
trans-unit.target: Logic Apps Connector Documentation

trans-unit.source: Logic Apps Forum
trans-unit.target: Logic Apps Forum

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how, in just a few minutes, you can get started with [App Services Logic Apps](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how, in just a few minutes, you can get started with [App Services Logic Apps](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: We'll walk through a workflow that lets you deliver a set of Tweets that you’re interested in to a Dropbox folder.
trans-unit.target: We'll walk through a workflow that lets you deliver a set of Tweets that you’re interested in to a Dropbox folder.

trans-unit.source: To use this scenario you will need:
trans-unit.target: To use this scenario you will need:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Twitter account
trans-unit.target: A Twitter account

trans-unit.source: A Dropbox account
trans-unit.target: A Dropbox account

trans-unit.source: Get your connectors
trans-unit.target: Get your connectors

trans-unit.source: First, you need to create the two connectors you will be using: [Dropbox Connector](app-service-logic-connector-dropbox.md) and [Twitter Connector](app-service-logic-connector-twitter.md).
trans-unit.target: First, you need to create the two connectors you will be using: [Dropbox Connector](app-service-logic-connector-dropbox.md) and [Twitter Connector](app-service-logic-connector-twitter.md).

trans-unit.source: Due to restrictions on the Twitter API, we will also need to register for a free app with Twitter.
trans-unit.target: Due to restrictions on the Twitter API, we will also need to register for a free app with Twitter.

trans-unit.source: To create these:
trans-unit.target: To create these:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click [Marketplace ](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/GalleryFeaturedMenuItemBlade/selectedMenuItemId/apiapps) on the home screen and search for Twitter (or [click here](https://portal.azure.com/#create/microsoft_com.TwitterConnector.0.2.2)).
trans-unit.target: Click [Marketplace ](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/GalleryFeaturedMenuItemBlade/selectedMenuItemId/apiapps) on the home screen and search for Twitter (or [click here](https://portal.azure.com/#create/microsoft_com.TwitterConnector.0.2.2)).

trans-unit.source: Select **Twitter Connector** and click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Twitter Connector** and click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: You will get a view for all of your settings.
trans-unit.target: You will get a view for all of your settings.

trans-unit.source: You can leave the name as **Twitter Connector**.
trans-unit.target: You can leave the name as **Twitter Connector**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Package settings**--here you'll need to input the information from your Twitter Application.
trans-unit.target: Select **Package settings**--here you'll need to input the information from your Twitter Application.

trans-unit.source: You can set up a free application using these steps:
trans-unit.target: You can set up a free application using these steps:

trans-unit.source: Go to the [Twitter App Registration Page](http://apps.twitter.com).
trans-unit.target: Go to the [Twitter App Registration Page](http://apps.twitter.com).

trans-unit.source: Create a new app.
trans-unit.target: Create a new app.

trans-unit.source: Give it a name and description.
trans-unit.target: Give it a name and description.

trans-unit.source: You can input any URL for the website, and leave the callback URL blank.
trans-unit.target: You can input any URL for the website, and leave the callback URL blank.

trans-unit.source: Once registered, copy the **Consumer Key** from Twitter into the **clientId** field in Azure, and the **Consumer Secret** from Twitter into the **clientSecret.**
trans-unit.target: Once registered, copy the **Consumer Key** from Twitter into the **clientId** field in Azure, and the **Consumer Secret** from Twitter into the **clientSecret.**

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** in the Azure pane to return to the other API settings.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** in the Azure pane to return to the other API settings.

trans-unit.source: Type a plan name in **Create new app service plan**.
trans-unit.target: Type a plan name in **Create new app service plan**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]The steps in this section assume that you are creating a new app service plan.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]The steps in this section assume that you are creating a new app service plan.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an existing app service plan, you click **Select Existing**, select your existing plan, and then skip to the last step in this section.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an existing app service plan, you click **Select Existing**, select your existing plan, and then skip to the last step in this section.

trans-unit.source: You need a plan to host all of your apps.
trans-unit.target: You need a plan to host all of your apps.

trans-unit.source: Select a **Pricing tier** for your new plan.
trans-unit.target: Select a **Pricing tier** for your new plan.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]By default, only plans recommended for Logic Apps are displayed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]By default, only plans recommended for Logic Apps are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Click **View all** to see all available plans.
trans-unit.target: Click **View all** to see all available plans.

trans-unit.source: When you run a logic app in the Free tier, you can only run every hour and use up to 1000 actions per month.
trans-unit.target: When you run a logic app in the Free tier, you can only run every hour and use up to 1000 actions per month.

trans-unit.source: Create a **Resource group** for your flow.
trans-unit.target: Create a **Resource group** for your flow.

trans-unit.source: Resource groups act as containers for your apps.
trans-unit.target: Resource groups act as containers for your apps.

trans-unit.source: All of the resources for your app will live in the same resource group.
trans-unit.target: All of the resources for your app will live in the same resource group.

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one Azure subscription, choose the one you will use.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one Azure subscription, choose the one you will use.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Location** to run your Logic app.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Location** to run your Logic app.

trans-unit.source: Create API app view
trans-unit.target: Create API app view

trans-unit.source: Click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: The provisioning step may take a minute or two.
trans-unit.target: The provisioning step may take a minute or two.

trans-unit.source: Now repeat the process with [Dropbox](https://portal.azure.com/#create/microsoft_com.DropboxConnector.0.2.2).
trans-unit.target: Now repeat the process with [Dropbox](https://portal.azure.com/#create/microsoft_com.DropboxConnector.0.2.2).

trans-unit.source: Start the Logic app
trans-unit.target: Start the Logic app

trans-unit.source: Now, you need to create a new Logic app:
trans-unit.target: Now, you need to create a new Logic app:

trans-unit.source: Click **+ New** at the bottom-left of the screen, expand **Web + Mobile**, then click **Logic App**.
trans-unit.target: Click **+ New** at the bottom-left of the screen, expand **Web + Mobile**, then click **Logic App**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Create logic app view, where you provide some basic settings to get started.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Create logic app view, where you provide some basic settings to get started.

trans-unit.source: Create logic app view
trans-unit.target: Create logic app view

trans-unit.source: In **Name**, type a meaningful name for your logic app.
trans-unit.target: In **Name**, type a meaningful name for your logic app.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **App service plan** you used when creating your connectors.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **App service plan** you used when creating your connectors.

trans-unit.source: This automatically chooses the location, subscription and resource group for you.
trans-unit.target: This automatically chooses the location, subscription and resource group for you.

trans-unit.source: This takes care of the basic settings, but don't click **Create** just yet.
trans-unit.target: This takes care of the basic settings, but don't click **Create** just yet.

trans-unit.source: Next, you'll add triggers and actions to your workflow.
trans-unit.target: Next, you'll add triggers and actions to your workflow.

trans-unit.source: Add a trigger
trans-unit.target: Add a trigger

trans-unit.source: Triggers are what make your logic app run.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are what make your logic app run.

trans-unit.source: Next, you'll add a recurrence trigger, which starts your workflow on a predefined schedule.
trans-unit.target: Next, you'll add a recurrence trigger, which starts your workflow on a predefined schedule.

trans-unit.source: Still in the **Create logic app** view, click **Triggers and actions**.
trans-unit.target: Still in the **Create logic app** view, click **Triggers and actions**.

trans-unit.source: This displays a full-screen designer that displays your flow.
trans-unit.target: This displays a full-screen designer that displays your flow.

trans-unit.source: On the right-hand side is a list of all services that could have triggers.
trans-unit.target: On the right-hand side is a list of all services that could have triggers.

trans-unit.source: In the top section, click **Recurrence**.
trans-unit.target: In the top section, click **Recurrence**.

trans-unit.source: This adds a box where you can specify the recurrence settings.
trans-unit.target: This adds a box where you can specify the recurrence settings.

trans-unit.source: Recurrence
trans-unit.target: Recurrence

trans-unit.source: Choose a recurrence **Frequency** and **Interval** (such as once every 1 hour), then click the green checkmark.
trans-unit.target: Choose a recurrence **Frequency** and **Interval** (such as once every 1 hour), then click the green checkmark.

trans-unit.source: Now, you'll add an action to the flow.
trans-unit.target: Now, you'll add an action to the flow.

trans-unit.source: Add a Twitter action
trans-unit.target: Add a Twitter action

trans-unit.source: Actions are what your workflow does.
trans-unit.target: Actions are what your workflow does.

trans-unit.source: You can have any number of actions, and you can organize them so that information from one action is passed to the next.
trans-unit.target: You can have any number of actions, and you can organize them so that information from one action is passed to the next.

trans-unit.source: In the right-hand pane, click **Twitter connector**.
trans-unit.target: In the right-hand pane, click **Twitter connector**.

trans-unit.source: After it loads, click **Authorize**, sign in to your Twitter account and click **Authorize app**.
trans-unit.target: After it loads, click **Authorize**, sign in to your Twitter account and click **Authorize app**.

trans-unit.source: This grants the connector access to your Twitter account.
trans-unit.target: This grants the connector access to your Twitter account.

trans-unit.source: A list of possible operations provided by the Twitter connector is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A list of possible operations provided by the Twitter connector is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The **Authorize** button uses OAUTH security to connect to SaaS services, like Twitter.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The **Authorize** button uses OAUTH security to connect to SaaS services, like Twitter.

trans-unit.source: More on OAUTH at [OAUTH Security](app-service-logic-oauth-security.md).
trans-unit.target: More on OAUTH at [OAUTH Security](app-service-logic-oauth-security.md).

trans-unit.source: Click **Search tweets**, then in **Specify a query**, type something like `#MicrosoftAzure` and click the green checkmark.
trans-unit.target: Click **Search tweets**, then in **Specify a query**, type something like `#MicrosoftAzure` and click the green checkmark.

trans-unit.source: Twitter search
trans-unit.target: Twitter search

trans-unit.source: The Twitter connector is now part of the workflow.
trans-unit.target: The Twitter connector is now part of the workflow.

trans-unit.source: Add a Dropbox action and create the app
trans-unit.target: Add a Dropbox action and create the app

trans-unit.source: The final step is to add an action that uploads a tweets to a Dropbox file.
trans-unit.target: The final step is to add an action that uploads a tweets to a Dropbox file.

trans-unit.source: In the right-hand pane, click **Dropbox connector**.
trans-unit.target: In the right-hand pane, click **Dropbox connector**.

trans-unit.source: After provisioning is complete, click **Authorize**, sign in to your Dropbox account, and **Allow**.
trans-unit.target: After provisioning is complete, click **Authorize**, sign in to your Dropbox account, and **Allow**.

trans-unit.source: Authorize Dropbox connector
trans-unit.target: Authorize Dropbox connector

trans-unit.source: This grants the connector access to your Dropbox account.
trans-unit.target: This grants the connector access to your Dropbox account.

trans-unit.source: A list of possible operations provided by the Dropbox connector is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A list of possible operations provided by the Dropbox connector is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Click **Upload file**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Upload file**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Dropbox connector settings, which you must set to pass the data from the Twitter search to Dropbox.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Dropbox connector settings, which you must set to pass the data from the Twitter search to Dropbox.

trans-unit.source: Dropbox
trans-unit.target: Dropbox

trans-unit.source: In the **FilePath** field, type `/tweet.txt`
trans-unit.target: In the **FilePath** field, type `/tweet.txt`

trans-unit.source: In the **Content** field, click the `...` button and click the **Tweet text** option.
trans-unit.target: In the **Content** field, click the `...` button and click the **Tweet text** option.

trans-unit.source: This enters the value `@first(body('twitterconnector')).TweetText` into the textbox.
trans-unit.target: This enters the value `@first(body('twitterconnector')).TweetText` into the textbox.

trans-unit.source: This generated value contains the following parts:
trans-unit.target: This generated value contains the following parts:

trans-unit.source: Content part
trans-unit.target: Content part

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Indicates that you are entering a function, rather than an actual value.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that you are entering a function, rather than an actual value.

trans-unit.source: Gets the tweets that were returned by the Twitter connector query.
trans-unit.target: Gets the tweets that were returned by the Twitter connector query.

trans-unit.source: The search tweets action returns a list, but you only want to upload one file
trans-unit.target: The search tweets action returns a list, but you only want to upload one file

trans-unit.source: Selects the tweet message property.
trans-unit.target: Selects the tweet message property.

trans-unit.source: Click the green check mark to save the connector settings.
trans-unit.target: Click the green check mark to save the connector settings.

trans-unit.source: Now that the design is complete, click **Code view** at the top left of the designer, and notice that this is the JSON code that defines the workflow you just created in the designer.
trans-unit.target: Now that the design is complete, click **Code view** at the top left of the designer, and notice that this is the JSON code that defines the workflow you just created in the designer.

trans-unit.source: We will discuss this code more in the [next topic][Use logic app features].
trans-unit.target: We will discuss this code more in the [next topic][Use logic app features].

trans-unit.source: Click on the **OK** button at the bottom of the screen, then click the **Create** button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **OK** button at the bottom of the screen, then click the **Create** button.

trans-unit.source: This creates the new logic app.
trans-unit.target: This creates the new logic app.

trans-unit.source: Manage your logic app after creation
trans-unit.target: Manage your logic app after creation

trans-unit.source: Now your logic app is up and running.
trans-unit.target: Now your logic app is up and running.

trans-unit.source: Every time the scheduled workflow runs, it checks for tweets with the specific hashtag.
trans-unit.target: Every time the scheduled workflow runs, it checks for tweets with the specific hashtag.

trans-unit.source: When it finds a matching tweet, it puts it in your Dropbox.
trans-unit.target: When it finds a matching tweet, it puts it in your Dropbox.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you'll see how to disable the app, or see how it’s doing.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you'll see how to disable the app, or see how it’s doing.

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse** on the left side of the screen and select **Logic Apps**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse** on the left side of the screen and select **Logic Apps**.

trans-unit.source: Click the new logic app that you just created to see current status and general information.
trans-unit.target: Click the new logic app that you just created to see current status and general information.

trans-unit.source: To edit your new logic app, click **Triggers and Actions**.
trans-unit.target: To edit your new logic app, click **Triggers and Actions**.

trans-unit.source: To turn off the app, click **Disable** in the command bar.
trans-unit.target: To turn off the app, click **Disable** in the command bar.

trans-unit.source: In less than 5 minutes you were able to set up a simple logic app running in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: In less than 5 minutes you were able to set up a simple logic app running in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about using Logic Apps features, see [Use logic app features].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about using Logic Apps features, see [Use logic app features].

trans-unit.source: To learn about the Logic App definitions themselves, see [author Logic App definitions](app-service-logic-author-definitions.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn about the Logic App definitions themselves, see [author Logic App definitions](app-service-logic-author-definitions.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
